alert.note: Alert for Cass; Henry; Johnson (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 9:04PM CDT until March 25 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Big Creek at Blairstown affecting Johnson MO, Cass and Henry Counties. Blackwater River near Blue Lick affecting Saline and Cooper Counties. Chariton River near Prairie Hill affecting Chariton and Macon Counties. Grand River near Sumner affecting Linn MO, Chariton, Livingston and Carroll Counties. For the Big Creek...including Blairstown...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Blackwater River...including Blue Lick...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Chariton River...including Prairie Hill...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Grand River...including Sumner...Moderate flooding is forecast. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek at Blairstown. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, The west bank of the creek begins to flood. At 23.0 feet, Flooding occurs at the west approach to the N Highway bridge located 0.2 miles west of Blairstown. Flooding also occurs across B Highway near Big Creek which is several miles northwest of Blairstown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 21.6 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
